Key Match Events: Malik Monk scored 31 points, DeMar DeRozan added 29, and the Sacramento Kings beat the Memphis Grizzlies 138-130.
De’Aaron Fox added 23 points for the Kings, who won their third in a row.
Jaylen Wells had 30 points and Jarren Jackson Jr. scored 28 for the Grizzlies.
The Kings led 78-72 at the half, and 102-100 after three quarters.
The Grizzlies took a 110-109 lead on Scottie Pippen Jr.'s two free throws at the 7:56 mark of the fourth quarter.
The Kings went on a 20-10 run to regain the lead capped with a 3-pointer by Monk with 4:21 remaining.
Zach Edey returned from a two-game absence due to a concussion and had nine points and seven rebounds off the bench.
Ja Morant (right AC joint strain) and Marcus Smart (right index finger) did not play.
Keegan Murray missed his second straight game for the Kings (left ankle soreness).
Kings guard Devin Carter made his debut with the team in the first quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The teams combined for 150 points in the first half. The Kings made 29 of 59 shots from the field (52.7%) while the Grizzlies knocked down 26 of 50 shots (52%).
The teams made 17 3-pointers combined in the first quarter. The Kings were 10 of 18 while the Grizzlies made 7 of 11.
